page.title: 03Morwenstow Religion
page.content: The Parish Church lies in a steep wooded valley, half a mile from the sea. Parts of the building are{Norman though the{Saxon }font indicates wor- ship on the site from an earlier time. The list of vicars dates from the{13th century, and the church records are complete from{1588.}The 6 bells, three dating from the 18th century, were re- conditioned and rehung in 1983. Today there is a thriving band of ringers. The congregation averages 25 to 30, greater numbers attending at festivals There has been no resident vicar since 1960, when the living was combined with{Kilkhampton. The{Methodist Chapel}at{Shop}was built in 1913. It is one of 17 chapels on the{Bude circuit.}The average congreg- ation is 25, with a Sunday School of about 30. (see{Hawker})
